question: What is the underlying commitment that anthropologists follow as they practice cultural relativism?

answers.text: To not judge the merits of certain beliefs and practices, but rather to seek to understand the wider contexts that produce and reinforce them
To judge the merits of cultural beliefs and practices relative to each other within the same cultural system
To work alongside cultural insiders to help them understand how best to improve their cultural practices relative to neighboring groups with the same practices
To adopt an “anything goes” mindset in their research
